sourceDates.note: Fees applicable to tickets issued from May 1, 2022. Noted in Fees section.
Checked-in transport of short-nosed animals discontinued starting July 1, 2019. Noted under Transport Restrictions.
U.S. dog entry rules effective August 1, 2024. U.S. Entry Regulations notice.
U.S. DOT service animal rules effective March 1, 2021. Service animals section.

policyFindings: Reservations: Request pet approval in advance; deadline is at least 24 business hours before domestic and 48 business hours before international departures. Walk-ups without prior approval will be refused.

Eligible species and quantities: Dogs, cats, pet birds. One pet may be carried in-cabin per adult; up to two pets may be transported as checked baggage. Children cannot travel with pets in the cabin. One pair of birds per cage.

In-cabin limits: Pet + carrier must be ≤7 kg; max carrier size 45 × 32 × 21 cm; soft carrier height may be up to 26 cm if it compresses to 21 cm. One carrier per passenger; exceptions for two young littermates (<6 months), a mother with young, or a pair of birds. Pet must remain in the carrier; water only. Sit in designated pet seating. In Business Class, no under-seat stowage (except A321); carrier is placed elsewhere for taxi/takeoff/landing per crew.

Checked baggage (not cargo): Accepted when larger than cabin limits and if pet + crate ≤45 kg, crate L+W+H ≤285 cm, and height ≤84 cm. Numbers may be limited by aircraft/route. On A321 aircraft, pets cannot be checked on international routes.

Crate standards: Lockable; leak-proof bottom with pad; ventilated; strong material (metal/wood/plastic). Birds must be covered. Two pets per crate not allowed, except for two puppies/kittens <6 months, a mother with young, or a pair of birds. For cabin, fabric/leather allowed if frame keeps shape; soft cases recommended to fit under seat.

Restrictions/embargoes: Transport refused if destination laws restrict, aircraft pet quota exceeded, or crate standards not met. Pets <16 weeks or sedated are not accepted. Pregnant, foul-smelling, ferocious animals and birds of prey are not accepted. Air Busan codeshare flights cannot provide pet checking services.
Short-nosed breeds: Checked-in transport is not allowed (effective July 1, 2019). Listed examples include Bulldog, Pug, Shih Tzu, Boxer; cat breeds such as Persian, Himalayan, Exotic, etc.

Dangerous dog restrictions: Examples include Tosa, Pit Bull types, American Staffordshire Terrier, Staffordshire Bull Terrier, Rottweiler, Mastiff and mixes, Laika, Ovtcharka, Kangal, Wolfdog, American Bully, Cane Corso, Miniature Bull Terrier.

Fees: A separate pet fee applies whether in-cabin or checked. For tickets issued from May 1, 2022: Domestic KRW 30,000 (≤32 kg) / KRW 60,000 (32–45 kg); Korea RT Japan/China/Taiwan/HK/Mongolia KRW 140,000 / 290,000; Other Asia (incl. Guam/Saipan) KRW 210,000 / 440,000; U.S./Europe/Oceania KRW 290,000 / 590,000. Overseas airports may collect local taxes.

Service animals (U.S. segments): Only trained service dogs are accepted; up to two per passenger; must be leashed/harnessed, stay under the seat, and not block aisles. May be denied for improper behavior or if required U.S. DOT forms (Transportation and Relief Attestation) are not submitted; reserve at least 48 business hours in advance. Emotional Support Animals are not recognized as service animals on U.S. routes under these DOT rules.
U.S. dog entry (from Aug 1, 2024): Dogs arriving to the U.S. must be ≥6 months, microchipped, and have CDC Dog Import Form approval; exact documents vary by origin.
notes: This summary is taken from Asiana’s official Traveling with pets page on February 1, 2026. Policies can vary by route/aircraft and by local laws; always confirm with Asiana Reservations before booking.
No operator notes were provided; none to verify.

finalDoc.PetPolicySummary:
Reservations: Request approval in advance. Deadline: at least 24 business hours before domestic departures and 48 business hours before international departures. Walk-ups without prior approval are refused.
Eligible pets and quantities: Dogs, cats, and pet birds. One pet may be carried in-cabin per adult; up to two pets may be transported as checked baggage. Children cannot bring pets in the cabin. One pair of birds may share a cage.
In-cabin limits: Pet + carrier must be ≤7 kg. Carrier size must be within 45 × 32 × 21 cm; soft carriers may be up to 26 cm tall if they compress to 21 cm to fit under the seat. One carrier per passenger; exceptions allow two puppies/kittens under 6 months, a mother with her young, or a pair of birds to share. Pet must remain inside the carrier; water only. Designated pet seating applies. In Business Class, no under-seat stowage (except A321); carrier may be placed elsewhere during taxi/takeoff/landing per crew.
Checked baggage: Accepted when exceeding cabin limits, if pet + crate ≤45 kg; crate L+W+H ≤285 cm and height ≤84 cm. Crate must be lockable, leakproof bottom with pad, ventilated, and sturdy (metal/wood/plastic). Bird cages must be covered. One pet per crate except for two puppies/kittens <6 months, a mother with young, or a pair of birds. Numbers may be limited by aircraft/route. On A321 aircraft, pets cannot be checked on international routes. Air Busan codeshare flights do not offer pet check-in.
Restrictions: Transport may be refused due to destination laws, aircraft pet quota, or non-compliant crates. Not accepted: pets under 16 weeks, sedated pets, pregnant pets, foul-smelling pets, ferocious dogs and birds of prey. Short-nosed breeds are not accepted as checked baggage (effective July 1, 2019). Some countries/cities may cap checked pet weight at 32 kg regardless of crate size.
Fees: A separate pet fee applies whether in-cabin or checked; overseas airports may collect local taxes. For tickets issued from May 1, 2022, typical fees per sector include: Domestic KRW 30,000 (≤32 kg) / KRW 60,000 (32–45 kg); Korea ↔ Japan/China/Taiwan/HK/Mongolia KRW 140,000 / 290,000; Other Asia (incl. Guam/Saipan) KRW 210,000 / 440,000; U.S./Europe/Oceania KRW 290,000 / 590,000.
Service animals: Trained service dogs only (up to two per passenger); must be harnessed/leashed, behave properly, and remain on the floor at the passenger’s feet. Reserve at least 48 business hours in advance; U.S. DOT forms required for U.S. flights. May be denied for improper behavior or missing forms.
U.S. entry for dogs (from Aug 1, 2024): Dogs arriving to the U.S. must be at least 6 months old, microchipped, and have CDC Dog Import Form approval; required documents vary by origin.
Arrive early to complete pet procedures.
finalDoc.ImprovedPetPolicySummary:
Asiana Airlines Pet Policy (Summary)

Reservations

  • Request approval in advance: at least 24 business hours before domestic and 48 business hours before international departures.
  • Walk-ups without prior approval/confirmation are not accepted.

Eligible Pets & Quantity

  • Dogs, cats, and pet birds are accepted.
  • Per adult: 1 pet in-cabin and up to 2 pets as checked baggage. Children cannot bring pets in the cabin.
  • One pair of birds may share a cage.

In-Cabin Limits

  • Pet + carrier: ≤ 7 kg total.
  • Carrier size: max 45 × 32 × 21 cm; soft carriers may be up to 26 cm tall if they compress to 21 cm to fit under the seat.
  • One carrier per passenger; exceptions: two puppies/kittens < 6 months, a mother with her young, or a pair of birds may share.
  • Pet must stay inside the carrier; water only.
  • Designated pet seating applies. In Business Class, under-seat stowage is unavailable (except A321); during taxi/takeoff/landing, crew will guide where to place the carrier.

Checked (Pet as Baggage)

  • Accepted if exceeding cabin limits and within: pet + crate ≤ 45 kg; L+W+H ≤ 285 cm; crate height ≤ 84 cm.
  • Crate: lockable; leakproof bottom with pad; well-ventilated; sturdy (metal/wood/plastic). Bird cages must be covered. One pet per crate except the noted young/mother/bird exceptions.
  • Operational limits by route/aircraft. On A321 aircraft, pets cannot be checked on international routes. Air Busan codeshares do not offer pet check-in.

Restrictions

  • Transport may be refused due to destination laws, aircraft pet quotas, or non-compliant crates.
  • Not accepted: pets < 16 weeks, sedated pets, pregnant pets, foul-smelling pets, ferocious dogs, and birds of prey.
  • Short-nosed breeds: checked transport discontinued effective July 1, 2019. Some countries/cities impose a 32 kg checked-pet limit.

Fees

  • Pet fees apply per pet in addition to baggage; local taxes may apply.
  • For tickets issued from May 1, 2022 (per sector): Domestic KRW 30,000 (≤32 kg) / KRW 60,000 (32–45 kg); Korea ↔ Japan/China/Taiwan/HK/Mongolia KRW 140,000 / 290,000; Other Asia (incl. Guam/Saipan) KRW 210,000 / 440,000; U.S./Europe/Oceania KRW 290,000 / 590,000.

Service Animals

  • Only trained service dogs accepted (up to two per passenger). Must be leashed/harnessed, behave properly, and stay at the passenger’s feet.
  • Reserve at least 48 business hours in advance and submit required U.S. DOT forms for U.S. routes. Boarding may be denied for improper behavior or missing forms.

U.S. Dog Entry (from Aug 1, 2024)

  • Dogs entering the U.S. must be ≥ 6 months old, microchipped, and have CDC Dog Import Form approval; documents vary by origin.
finalDoc.inCompartmentDetails: In-cabin allowed for dogs, cats, and small birds: max 1 carrier per adult; pet + carrier ≤ 7 kg; carrier max 45 × 32 × 21 cm (soft-sided up to 26 cm if compressible to 21 cm); pet must remain inside the carrier; designated pet seating; Business Class under-seat stowage unavailable except on A321.
finalDoc.inCargoDetails: Checked pet allowed when exceeding cabin limits: pet + crate ≤ 45 kg; L+W+H ≤ 285 cm; crate height ≤ 84 cm; sturdy lockable ventilated crate with leakproof bottom and pad; birds must have covered cages. A321 aircraft: pets cannot be checked on international routes. Some destinations cap checked-pet weight at 32 kg.
finalDoc.carrierCompartmentDetails:
In-Cabin Carrier Details

Reservation Deadline:

  • Domestic flights: At least 24 business hours before scheduled departure.
  • International flights: At least 48 business hours before scheduled departure.

Pets without prior reservation or confirmation will not be allowed on board or as checked baggage.

Eligible Pets and Quantity:

  • Each adult passenger may bring 1 pet into the cabin and 2 pets as checked baggage.
  • Children are not allowed to travel with pets in the cabin.
  • One pair of birds per cage is permitted.

Weight and Size Limits for Cabin Pets:

  • Combined weight of pet and cage must not exceed 7 kg.
  • Transport container dimensions must not exceed:
    • Height: 21 cm (26 cm for soft cages when uncompressed; compressed height must not exceed 21 cm)
    • Width: 32 cm
    • Length: 45 cm
  • Rigid frame cages (wire, plastic, wood) maximum height: 21 cm.

Cage and Pet Restrictions:

  • One cage per passenger, one pet per cage.
  • Puppies or kittens under 6 months, a mother with her young, or a pair of birds may share a cage.
  • Pets must remain inside cages throughout the flight and may only be given water.

Business Class Seating:

  • Pet containers cannot be placed under the seat due to seat structure and safety regulations.
  • Containers will be placed in another area with flight attendant guidance during taxiing, take-off, and landing.
  • Underseat storage for pet containers is not available in Business Class except on A321 aircraft.
  • Passengers traveling with pets must be seated in designated pet seating.

Pet Carry-On Cages (Domestic Flights):

  • Available for purchase at domestic airports (excluding Incheon Airport).
  • Permitted soft cage size: Width 39 cm × Height 26 cm × Depth 22.5 cm.
  • Weight: 540 g (+ 200 g with footrest).
  • Fully covered with mesh screens and double top and side covers.
  • Includes a Saekdongi character name tag.
finalDoc.carrierCargoDetails:
In Cargo Carrier Details

If the pet exceeds the cabin baggage size specifications, the following conditions apply for cargo transport:

  • Pet and cage combined weight must be 45 kg or less.
  • The sum of the cage's three dimensions must be 285 cm or less.
  • Cage height must not exceed 84 cm.

The number of pets allowed in cabin or checked may be restricted or refused depending on aircraft type and route.

  • Note: On A321 aircraft, pets cannot be checked on international routes.

Cage Conditions

  • Must have a lock, sealed bottom, and sufficient ventilation.
  • Waterproof construction with a waterproof pad on the bottom, plus towel or blanket inside.
  • Enough space for the pet to stand and move comfortably.
  • Bird cages must be covered with cloth during flight to prevent exposure.
  • Made of strong materials such as metal, wood, or plastic.
  • If brought inside the cabin, cages may be fabric or leather but must maintain shape with a frame.
  • Only one pet per cage, except for:
    • Two puppies or two kittens under 6 months old
    • A mother with her young
    • A pair of birds

Transport Restrictions

  • Pets are not allowed if restricted by destination city or country laws.
  • Pets exceeding the allowable number for the aircraft are not permitted.
  • Cages not meeting transportation standards are prohibited.
  • Sum of cage dimensions over 285 cm or combined weight over 45 kg is not allowed.
  • Some countries/cities may impose a lower weight limit of 32 kg or other aircraft restrictions regardless of size or weight.
  • Pets under 16 weeks old or given stabilizers/sleep medicine cannot be transported.
  • Pregnant pets, foul smelling pets, ferocious dogs (attack dogs and other fierce animals), and birds of prey are prohibited.

Checked-in transport of short-nosed animals has been discontinued due to health and safety risks (effective July 1, 2019).

Transporting pets in very cold or hot weather may negatively impact their health. Please consider your pet’s safety when deciding on transportation.
Air Busan codeshare flights are not operated by Asiana Airlines and do not provide pet checking services.
finalDoc.dangerousBreedList: Tosa dogs and crossbreeds, American Pitbull Terriers and crossbreeds, American Staffordshire Terriers and crossbreeds, Staffordshire Bull Terriers and crossbreeds, Rottweilers and crossbreeds, Mastiff and mixed breed, Laika and mixed breed, Ovtcharka and mixed breed, Kangal and mixed breed, Wolfdog and mixed breed, American bully, Cane Corso and mixed breed, Miniature Bull Terrier and mixed breed
finalDoc.serviceAnimalDetails:
Service Animals (In-Cabin & Support)

Effective March 1, 2021, Asiana Airlines follows U.S. DOT regulations for service animals based on the departure date.

  • Service dogs must have an identification tag from an accredited institution and wear a harness or leash.
  • Allowed only for providing airline travel assistance.
  • Service animals must be dogs aged 16 weeks or older.
  • Dogs must be trained to behave properly in public and remain under the passenger’s control.
  • Service dogs must stay on the floor space below or under the passenger's feet at all times and cannot intrude into other passengers’ seats or roam the aisle.
  • Up to two service dogs are allowed per passenger.

Passengers may be denied boarding if:

  • The service dog shows behavior indicating it is not properly trained.
  • The service dog barks excessively or defecates in the boarding area or on board the aircraft.
  • Reservations are not made at least 48 hours prior to flight departure (working days).
  • The passenger refuses or fails to complete and submit the required U.S. DOT Service Animal Transportation and Relief Attestation Forms at the airport.
